vehicleId.description:
Vehicle Id
Required: true
vehicleId can be retrieved from /car/search endpoint(data->search_results->vehicle_info->v_id)
Ex: 678151356

searchKey.description:
Search key
Required: true
searchKey can be retrieved from /car/search endpoint(data->search_key)
Ex:


units.description:
Units
Ex: metric
Default value: metric

metric: Metric (km, m2)
imperial: Imperial (miles, ft2)

languageCode.description:
Language
languageCode can be retrieved from /languages endpoint(data->code)
Ex: en-us
Default value: en-us

currencyCode.description:
Currency
currencyCode can be retrieved from /currencies endpoint(data->code)
Ex: USD
Default value: HOTEL(Property's Currency)

countryFlag.description:
Country
countryFlag can be retrieved from /languages endpoint(data->countryFlag)
Ex: us
Default value: us

enhanced_parameters.vehicleId: Unique identifier for the vehicle, sourced from car search results.
enhanced_parameters.searchKey: Encoded search parameters from car search, including pickup/drop-off details.
enhanced_parameters.units: Measurement system for distance (metric or imperial).
enhanced_parameters.languageCode: Language preference for the response data.
enhanced_parameters.countryFlag: Country code for regional settings or localization.

depends_on.reason: The 'vehicleId' parameter in the target API is explicitly mentioned to be retrievable from the '/car/search' endpoint's response under 'data->search_results->vehicle_info->v_id'. The source API's response field '$.search_results[*].vehicle_info.v_id' directly provides this information, matching both the data type (String) and the exact field path specified in the target API's documentation.

The 'searchKey' parameter in the target API is explicitly mentioned to be retrieved from the '/car/search' endpoint's response field 'data->search_key'. The source API's '$.search_key' field matches exactly in name and purpose, providing the necessary encoded search parameters for the target API. This is a direct prerequisite for calling the target API.

The '$.search_context.searchKey' field in the source API also contains the searchKey value, but it is nested within a context object. While it could technically be used, the direct '$.search_key' field is more straightforward and explicitly mentioned in the target API's documentation.
